intro: Phacelia californica f. vinctens, commonly known as the California phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open areas such as meadows and woodland edges. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. This species is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
